intro: Echium sanguineum, commonly known as the common bluemink, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and striking blue to purple flower heads composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and along coastal areas. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making it an important species in ecological gardens. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
